turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Munio of Zamora.
turn.1: What happened during the tenth general crisis?
turn.2: Upon the ascension to the Throne of St. Peter, the Franciscan friar, Pope Nicholas IV, took Munio's legislation as a reason to edit the Dominican Rule in its entirety.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: After Nicholas' election, rumors and stories about Munio's past started to circulate in Rome.
turn.5: What were some of the rumors?
turn.6: Among them were the charges that he had been elected thanks, in large part, to the manipulations and bribery of his patron, King Sancho IV of Castile.
turn.7: Was there any truth to that?
turn.8: It was further alleged that Munio was also in the background when Sancho had authorized a payment of 30,000 "maravedís" to Cardinal Ordoño in 1285, just one month after Munio had been elevated to Master General.
turn.10: This was to cover the fact that Munio, dissolute and violent, made an earlier appearance in an affair involving a monastery of Dominican nuns in the small provincial city of his hometown of Zamora, which had occasioned a canonical visitation by the Bishop of Zamora in 1279.
turn.11: What was the outcome of the rumor?
turn.12: The community of Dominican nuns was split into factions, and the Dominican friars were behaving like characters from the "Decameron.
